I took a seminar in this year with an
acting teacher named Judith Weston and I
learned a key insight to character she
believed that all well-drawn characters
have a spine and the idea is that the
character has an inner motor a dominant
unconscious goal that they're striving
for an itch that they can't scratch she
gave a wonderful example of Michael
Corleone Al Pacino's character in The
Godfather and that probably his spine
was to please his father and it's

it and there's no changing it all you

when you mature enough to acknowledge
what drives you and to take the wheel
